thread.title: Olivia Culpo shares photo of Danny Amendola celebrating | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Olivia Culpo shares photo of Danny Amendola celebrating | Daily Mail Online

author: Stephanie Haney At Dailymail.Com
title: Olivia Culpo shares photo of Danny Amendola celebrating | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Of course, teams win and lose games together, but there's no mistake to be made about the fact that Amendola played a pretty pivotal role in turning what was a 28-3 deficit at halftime around to bring home this win. Proud girlfriend: 'This might just be my new favorite picture ever,' Culpo wrote with the post, clearly overjoyed her man's accomplishments; seen here on the field after the win on Sunday That was not lost on Culpo, who shared a post-game photo from the field with her Wide Receiver, writing, 'When your man turns the entire Super Bowl around,' with the hashtag 'proud.' 'What a game,' she added. In that moment when her beau scored the extra two points after touchdown that tied up the contest, Culpo was quick to tweet her excitement, in all caps, which is 'internet speak' for shouting. 'Danny just tied the Super Bowl,' she wrote. 'Mind is blown ' So excited! In that moment when her beau tied up the contest, Culpo was quick to tweet her excitement, in all caps, which is 'internet speak' for shouting No one knew exactly how it was going to end, but it was safe to say that virtually no one expected a 25-point comeback for the Patriots in the second half, let alone that final touchdown that brought the game to a close. The actor, presenter and cellist couldn't hold back tears as the Patriots scored that last six points in overtime to seal the deal and make Tom Brady surpass Joe Montana and Terry Bradshaw as the NFL Quarterback with the most Super Bowl wins in history. Culpo, who attended the game in person on Sunday at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas with friends, had a lot to be proud about that night. 'So proud!': The actor, presenter and cellist couldn't hold back tears as the Patriots scored that last six points in overtime to seal the deal In good company: Culpo, who attended the game in person on Sunday at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas with friends, had a lot to be proud about that night Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
